main event: A bright, silver object was observed in the sky over Cincinnati, Ohio on November 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 25-30 feet in diameter and appeared to be the size of a basketball held at arm's length.
The object moved horizontally at a very high speed from west to east, then stopped and hovered, before moving off rapidly.
The object was completely silent and had no lights or other distinguishing features.
The witness called his wife to also observe the object, which they had never seen anything like before.
The witness tried to estimate the object's position and motion, but was not very sure of the exact details.
sighted object: a large, bright silver disc-shaped object
witnesses: a male witness and his wife
